channel.title: What are your biggest pet peeves with games?
channel.description:
As the title says, share your biggest pet peeves with games today.
Remember, this is pet peeves, as in small stuff that's not a big deal but it just annoys you.
This is [u][b]NOT[/b][/u] a thread to talk about major issues like paying for DLC or Console vs PC/other console or some other bullshit like that.
So, a big pet peeve of mine is console related, specifically with the PS3 but I bet the 360 and Wii also have this issue, but I find it a bit annoying how console games these days do not let you exit the game from the main menu and instead you have to close it by pressing the Home button and closing the game from there.
I mean, really, why hasn't this been implemented yet?

item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
GARD:

EDIT: eh, actual topic:
Medic and support class merging into one thing (as in BC2, with their overpowered M60s and such). I fucking hate this, i enjoy BC2 very much, but this can just ruin my day. Medics aren’t supposed to be the guy carrying the best weapon on the battlefield, hence they should focus on HELPING the team… DAMN IT!

The m60 and all them are pretty shitty guns. They take days to get a kill, they’re really inaccurate and they take an hour to reload. Really the only thing they’re useful at is flanking a swarm of enemies and killing them from close range. You really need to get a big drop on someone to kill them with a LMG, otherwise they just turn around and kill you first.

The good guns are things like the abrakan and the ump.

item.title: What are your biggest pet peeves with games?
item.dc:creator: Steagle
item.description:
Where do I start?

  1. Publishers charging full price for half a game. In the age of lazy developers using multi-player as a crutch, a new pricing model is needed. If you are going to release half a game, release a version stripped up multi-player and vise versa. I don’t do multi-player so I almost always wait until the price drops to a reasonable level. Crysis 2 is the first game I have bought at full price since being burned by COD 4 but then again, I got a $20 pre-order credit plus pre-order pricing. The same with Portal 2 and Fear 3.

  2. Lack of auto-save. Look, I have children and other responsibilities. I often time need to needlessly replay sections of games after being forced to quit during the middle of a section. Doesn’t need to happen.

  3. First person shooters without the ability to go prone.

  4. Endlessly spawning bad guys.

  5. Games that should be great but aren’t because of console limitations. Biggest offender, Crysis 2. You could see it by playing it. This games should have been the greatest game since Half Life 2. Even though it was clearly developed for the PC and ported to consoles, far too many compromises were made which turned what should have been an all-time great into a merely above average first person shooter.

item.title: What are your biggest pet peeves with games?
item.dc:creator: Lost_one
item.description:
Toltuk:

I agree, I play WoW and after tanking more then half a dungeon with a group some new guy comes in and starts talking to me like im a 12 year old telling me how to tank. And rest of group sits there in silence.

I’m about to start going online in monster hunter tri and I guarantee that someone is going to tell me to start playing the game their way and using heavy armor and 10-ton swords.

The problem is that there is no consequence for these shitheads. If you were allowed to smack em up their head which our nambi pambi society doesn’t allow. Gaming experience would be Much Different and much more pleasant.

you can automatically tell their age range by how much they jump to next destination or in 1 place.

Haven’t played brothers in arms series.

Oh god don’t I know it. I don’t remember when this was but I was DPSing for a tank in WoW once, and he said he liked to pull big. I was playing druid feral at the time and was around early 30s. Back then skills pulled threat not forms or stances or whatever. And when he pulled too much for us to take down quickly, I jumped into my bear form and started spamming my AoE to do as much damage as possible. From then on he kept trying to tell me how to dps. I didn’t have an AoE for cat form so I made due with what I had. Finally got sick of it, and went to leave when the guy ran straight for the final boss in the final room before clearing the side rooms, and pulled everything that was left. Killing the group. I jumped ship before I got killed.

Kids think they know everything. Theres more than one way to play games, and people fail to realize this. Just because you found one way, doesn’t mean everyone has to follow that way. Thats like going into a maze and someone goes “Theres an easy way through!” And starts breaking down the walls to the other side, ruining the maze for everyone else that wants to do it themselves.

item.title: What are your biggest pet peeves with games?
item.dc:creator: Thecromewriter
item.description:
Orpheon:

Well, every time you fight him up until the last form of the final battle (when he’s in the robot thing) were kind of difficult, and the very first fight, when you take Colette to the tower, is pretty much impossible. His very last form is pretty weak though, which is kinda disappointing. Even more so if you were doing all the side quests, which would mean you would have to fight through the cursed book and defeat Abyssion for the cursed weapons quest. In comparison to Abyssion, Yggdrasil/Mithos is a cake walk.

That’s right. I forgot about the robot thing after the first stage of the fight. And for the side quest thing, Sword Dancer? God damned impossible 2nd or 3rd time around.

Anyways, my biggest pet peeve gaming wise is probably not the games itself, but more the people who consider themselves hardcore gamers because they play to much CoD. I ask, “What do you think of Half-Life, then?” They respond, “What-Life?” How about classical Mario or some Tetris? “They’re both retarded wannabe CoDs.” You heard it from the experts of the gaming industry, every video game in existence and maybe even hands-on physical activity games are just wannabe Call of Duty games.
